reviewText: If you don't mind black and white shows, you'll enjoy this set of classic television Christmas shows. I really enjoyed the simple, yet heartwarming stories each episode presented. It's a far cry from the comic, slapstick antics of today's sitcoms. The sound and image quilaty was good which I was extremely happy about!

reviewText: With this fun, moderately-priced DVD, you can programme your very own "Nick at Nite" or "TV Land" Christmas sitcom mini marathon!  Perfect for Christmas Eve viewing especially, MERRY SITCOM! presents holiday themed episodes from "Father Knows Best", "The Donna Reed Show", "McHale's Navy", "Bewitched", "The Flying Nun" and "That Girl"; plus a rare episode from a one-season wonder called "Window on Main Street".Episodes:"The Christmas Story" (FATHER KNOWS BEST) - Wanting to show his family the true meaning of Christmas cheer, Jim (Robert Young) drags them all on an expedition into the forest to find the ideal Christmas tree.  When they become stranded, a lonely squatter named Nick (Wallace Ford) comes to their aid."A Very Merry Christmas" (THE DONNA REED SHOW) - Disillusioned by her family's calculated view of gift-giving, Donna Stone (Donna Reed) decides to concentrate her efforts by instead helping hospital janitor Charlie (Buster Keaton) in organising Santa's annual visit to the children's ward."The Day They Captured Santa Claus" (MCHALE'S NAVY) - Whilst delivering some Christmas cheer to the orphans under the care of missionary Mrs. Parfrey (Anna Lee), McHale (Ernest Borgnine) and his men come under the attack of a Japanese patrol unit."Visions of Sugar Plums" (BEWITCHED) - When an orphan (Billy Mumy), who doesn't believe in Santa Claus, visits the Stephens' for Christmas, Samantha (Elizabeth Montgomery) takes him to the North Pole to visit the man in red himself.  One of the gems from BEWITCHED's first year, this episode was repeated again in the following season."Christmas and the Hard Luck Kid" (THAT GIRL) - Taking a break from her job as a department store elf, Ann Marie (Marlo Thomas) reminisces about a Christmas gone by, when she was a teacher in a boarding school."Wailing in a Winter Wonderland" (THE FLYING NUN) - Sister Bertrille (Sally Field) intends to create a mild snowstorm by peppering the clouds over Convent San Tanco with dry ice, as a surprise for homesick Sister Olaf (Celia Lovsky).  Instead, she ruins San Juan's booming Christmas tourist trade!

reviewText: What a great collection of classic television Christmas episodes.  My kids (7 and 12) enjoyed watching these shows and wanted to watch them over again in the car.  It is nice to go back to watch 'good, clean, wholesome' tv, but it is also sad that we can't find anything like that on todays television.  My son liked the McHales Navy episode the best and my daughter was torn between Father Knows Best and Donna Reed.  If your family doesn't have the automatic black and white tv rejection chip installed in their heads, they will enjoy these programs.

reviewText: If you grew up in the 50's and watched Father Knows Best & That Girl, along with other sitcoms listed on Merry Sitcom, you should definitely purchase this dvd to watch during the Christmas Holiday Season.  My favorite episodes where Father Knows Best & That Girl, they show the simple meaning of Christmas in such a warm way.  I love Merry Sitcom!  Why don't they make Christmas Sitcom Shows like this anymore?

reviewText: I have a "thing" for watching Christmas Classics of the 50's and 60's during the holiday season. Probably comes with being a baby boomer. I have purchased several through Amazon (read my reviews) and must say that the stuff Amazon puts out are very good, can't be found in stores, and the prices are among the lowest around anywhere. This one disc set has about eleven Christmas episodes of different 60's shows, which give a nice diversity and enjoyment to put one in the Christmas mood and spirit.  If you are a sentimentalist, as I am, and enjoy watching the old sitcoms, you will love this item.Merry Christmas and peace!

reviewText: I gave this dvd to myself this past Christmas and I'm so glad that I did. It is terrific and reminds me, once again, how much better t.v. used to be not so long ago. The shows were actually about Christmas and the writers wrote dialogue where the characters cared about each other but not in an overly sentimental kind of way. Good writing, good acting, good sets--Merry Christmas to all!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is what Christmas is all about, watching vintage Christmas Shows. This collection is like the one CBS DVD put out last year. It is also jammed packed with Christmas mirth. Who can top Sister Bertrille as she try's to make a Christmas wish come true by sprinkling the clouds with dry ice. Or Samantha Stevens convincing a young boy that there really is a Santa Claus. Or Ann Marie forfeiting her own Christmas to share it with a young boy who's parents are working out of town. There is also a 7th Show included on this DVD "Windows On Main Street" starring Robert Young from Father Knows Best, I have never heard of this short lived show but I just loved it. Buy this if you want to see a Christmas show from a simpler time.
summary: They Don't Make Them Like This Anymore!

reviewText: Christmas and comedy. Two of my favorite TV themes. Add Classic television and you've got a triple reason why I love this DVD.Perhaps "Father Knows Best" but it's the spirit of Christmas in a vagrant with a warm heart which knows even better the yuletide is everywhere."The Great Stone Face" Buster Keaton makes for a wonderful Santa Claus on "The Donna Reed Show.""McHale's Navy', "Bewitched", "That Girl" and "The Flying Nun", all reminders of the long ago magic of the Christmas television of yesteryear."Window On Main Street" is the proverbial cherry on the top of this fun sundae of this TV holiday treat. With the episode, "Christmas Memory" presented here as an example, how remorseful it is the series didn't become as well known as Robert Young's other TV series, "Father Knows Best" and "Marcus Welby, M.D."
summary: A delightful combination of Christmas and nostalga
Title: N/A

reviewText: I enjoy watching this dvd. It is a great dvd. The shows on this dvd has brought back so many memories of a good time in life. Father Knows Best, Donna Reed Show, Bewitched, McHale's Navy, That Girl, The Flying Nun and Windows on Main Street are all great shows to watch. They are all about what our Christmas back then used to be. They don't make shows like this to watch anymore. If I didn't already own this dvd I would buy it. If you are a Baby Boomer raised in an era of life that was great and full of good things this is the dvd for you. This is one of my favorite dvd's. It is a true classic. Sandy
summary: Merry Sitcom! Christmas Classics from TV's Golden Age

reviewText: Really, you can't go wrong with these kinds of anthologies if you're fond of either classic TV or of holiday episodes (and I am a fan of both).It boggles my mind to look back and see that a show like "The Flying Nun" ever succeeded in a prime-time lineup. Holy Smokes.It's also funny to see how little really has changed in 50-odd years when it comes to people's thoughts on Christmas commercialism. Several of these episodes make woeful references to that very thing--how there's too much emphasis on materialism. And here we thought that this just came around since the 1980s.
Title: N/A
